data.body:
Audio/OggStream.cs
Class `OggStreamer`
Method `FillBuffer()`

``` C#
readerPosition = stream.Reader.DecodedPosition;
```

Is `readerPosition` variable need for something?
Or it was used or planned to be used with something like VorbisReader pool? Like a `readMutex` also.
I mean, for using many OggStream with one VorbisReader by seeking it.
For now I'm trying to implement this and plan to make SoundEffect use not only raw PCM data, but also Vorbis data, to reduce RAM usage.
`Song` class can be played only one instance in time, but I need many songs(or simply long sounds) played in one time. And this eats a lot of RAM with using raw PCM.
What do you think?

data.title: Dropping .deb linux installer
data.body:
Reasons to drop:
- It's Ubuntu only
- Ubuntu Software Center will say "Package of bad quality", some evil stuff would need to be done on the Mac build box to avoid this
- I see people not keeping mono repo enable, and then asking why they can't install the package
- Would be able to setup an ability to keep multiple MonoGame versions installed and a way to switch between them

We do have .run installer, which works on all Linux distros, including Ubuntu.

CC. @dellis1972 @KonajuGames

data.title: [OpenAL] Question about unnecessary(?) copy of sound data in RAM
data.body:
SoundEffect.OpenAL.cs have field 

``` C#
internal byte[] _data;
```

And as I can see, it is not used anywhere, it's just eats double size of sound in RAM.
I was trying to run one XNA game not ported to Linux with MonoGame, and with XNA this game eats only 200mb of ram, while with MonoGame on Linux it eats almost 3GB! I removed that _data field and get 1.5GB ram usage. With no stability issues. 
So i just wanted to ask, does that filed necessary or it can be safely removed to double reduce sound data ram usage?

Must be the way the app is building the font XNBs?

data.title: OculusRift via OculusWrap Support
data.body:
Hey, I've been working on some basic Oculus Rift support in a hobby project and Tom Spillman asked me post about what was missing in MonoGame for Oculus SDK. I've mostly got VR going with a Oculus SDK wrapper called OculusWrap:
https://oculuswrap.codeplex.com/
It uses DirectX11 through SharpDX so it wasn't too bad to port over the demo and I have a working project in MonoGame. However there's one main thing missing that I've encountered so far to get it properly integrated into MonoGame using mainly MonoGame API(rather than messily bypassing it with SharpDX).

The render targets are required in their SharpDX form, which means they are very awkward and live outside of MonoGame currently in my code. Being created in SharpDX.  Since I have to have them in this form pass to the SDK. It would be useful to have a ".Handle" perhaps similar to GraphicsDevice.Handle on DirectX11 platforms that returns an object we can cast to their SharpDX internal representations for Texture/Texture2D/RenderTarget2D.

This would allow for the creation of the targets required by the Oculus SDK with just new RenderTarget2Ds inside MonoGame and also for them to be handled normally in all other parts of MonoGame such as altering/drawing these targets. An example of what currently doesn't work without interrupting MonoGames drawing is the Mirrored screen mode. The Oculus SDK populates a target with what the user sees to draw on the monitor screen. Without interfering with MonoGames internal drawing with SharpDX(which seems to break rendering down the line) I can't draw this target to screen, since it isn't a MonoGame RenderTarget2D. Where as if I could setup all the textures within MonoGame I can simply draw this on a Quad to screen or via SpriteBatch.
